item.description:
"Who needs this workshop thing anyway? I mean, it's just a bunch of bright, constructive criticism about my work. Who wants that?"
"You do."
"Who are you?"
"I'm the Phantom of the Blue Shirt Cafe."
"What? I've never heard of you."
"That's because you've never wanted to. But now I feel it is my duty to show you the way of the workshop."
"Pfft. I don't need it."
"Oh really? Well I've been reading through your manuscript and while you have some good parts, it needs some....guidance."
"Really?"
"Yes, my child. Look at page 2. What are you trying to say?"
"Well that's the part where the girl finds out who her father is."
"So what's all this about muskrats?"
"Oh. Maybe you're right."
"Of course I am. Now sit down right here - session will start shortly."
"Oh, well. Okay. I guess."
"Have a Peanut Butter Delight. Everything will be fine."
"Mmmm that's...delicious. Thank you, Phantom of the Blue Shirt Cafe!"
"You're welcome."

And the moral of this story is...don't let Kate write Meetup descriptions on a scrambled brain?
Well yes, but more importantly - workshopping is good for you! :)

Taylor and Cassandra will meet the Phantom of the Blue Shirt cafe and get their work read and critiqued...All others read, attend, and enjoy Peanut Butter smoothies!
item.name: Workshop Shmurkshop
